subject: Management
title: The Meeting Audit
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Meeting Audit usable.

hook.text: A company calculated their meeting costs. One recurring meeting cost $3M per year in salary time.

buildup.text: Meetings multiply silently. Nobody audits them. They just keep recurring forever.

discovery.text: Shopify deleted 12,000 recurring meetings in one day. They called it a calendar purge.

twist.text: Most meetings exist because someone created them once. Not because they're still needed.

climax.text: Audit every recurring meeting quarterly. Ask: what would break if we stopped this? If nothing, stop it.

punchline.text: Delete the meeting. See if anyone notices. Usually, they don't.

quiz.question: What should you do with recurring meetings?
options: Audit them quarterly and eliminate those that wouldn't be missed
Keep them all since they were created for a reason
Replace every meeting with an email regardless of purpose
